alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:48AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE...NORTHERN CLINTON...CAMERON...CLEARFIELD...AND ELK COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 847 AM EDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from near St. Marys to 15 miles southeast of Ridgway to DuBois to Punxsutawney and moving east southeast at 20 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Benezette, Force and Medix Run around 855 AM EDT. Parker Dam State Park and Rockton around 900 AM EDT. Hicks Run around 905 AM EDT. S.B. Elliot State Park around 910 AM EDT. Curwensville around 925 AM EDT. Clearfield, Plymptonville and Hyde around 930 AM EDT. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Dubois and Milesburg exits, specifically from mile markers 97 to 147. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roadway and then quickly refreezes. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
